metadata.Title: CVE-2021-40491 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The ftp client in GNU Inetutils before 2.2 does not validate addresses returned by PASV/LSPV responses to make sure they match the server address. This is similar to CVE-2020-8284 for curl.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-40491` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

inetutils-ftp - 2:2.2-1
inetutils-ftpd - 2:2.2-1
inetutils-inetd - 2:2.2-1
inetutils-ping - 2:2.2-1
inetutils-syslogd - 2:2.2-1
inetutils-talk - 2:2.2-1
inetutils-talkd - 2:2.2-1
inetutils-telnet - 2:2.2-1
inetutils-telnetd - 2:2.2-1
inetutils-tools - 2:2.2-1
inetutils-traceroute - 2:2.2-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: inetutils package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:2.2-1').
